Dr. Toast Live @ Transported's 1-Year Anniversary DJ Bus

posted April 22, 2008 | music, shows

This Thursday, April 24th, 2008: Two DJs, one bus, one mobile soundsystem, cake, champagne! From Alxndr: "It's hard to believe we launched this mobile adventure called Transported a year ago now. We do appreciate the support and your willingness to try new things. And we're very excited to ask you to join us for our birthday party! We've asked a couple old friends to help us celebrate this Thursday: Dr. Toast & Piotron. We'll be supplying plenty of champagne and birthday cake so don't miss out. Note that we will NO LONGER be meeting at The Rite Spot. We are meeting at Shine for check-in at 7:30pm and our bus leaves at 8pm. We will return you there at 11:30pm."

Tickets are $20 and can be purchased here:

www.brownpapertickets.com/event/33896

For The German Students

posted April 17, 2008 | ask-dr-toast

Dear Dr. Toast,

We accidentally found your website during our search for some information about the toast's history and its consumer habits. We are 10 students from Germany who are participating at a famous marketing/design competition and our task is to create a complete new strategy/commercials for a very famous Toast Brand. To win this competition you could help us, as you are a famous toast doctor. We are sure you can help us to answer our questions [below]. It would be sooo helpful to get some answers. We will name your help in our presentation.

Thank you so much,

-- Angela from Germany (angeladies@xxxxx.com)

Q: Why did you decide to open a Dr. Toast site?

A: Dr. Biscuit, Dr. Pancake, and Dr. Huevos Rancheros were already taken.

Q: Why do you think people are so interested in toast and how many visitors do you have monthly?

People are interested in toast because it's a great way to meet new people and improve hand-eye coordination.

I receive approximately one hundred billion trillion monthly visitors to my site. To try to visualize this number, if you were to stack all of the monthly visitors on top of each other, they would reach all the way to the moon.

Q: What does toast mean for you and why toast and not bread?

A: To quote Alan Burdick: "To toast, then, is to ritually re-enact, daily and in miniature, the American dream itself. Each morning, in a small corner of the kitchen, the transformation of bread into cake prefigures (we hope) our own successful assault upon the social ladder. It is as if, by toasting, we ourselves might be toasted."

And toast, not bread, because Sara Lee holds the trademark on the term "Bread®" and my counsel advises against it.

Q: Which person could stand for toast?

A: I believe that a great American hero could stand for toast. Benjamin Franklin, Mark Wahlberg, and Maya Angelou come to mind.

Q: And last but not least - how can toast be a medium to bring people together?

A: I would like to see the world's pop superstars come together to sing an anthem of toast, a la "We Are The World", in order to send a message of love, tolerance, and understanding to all mankind. Here is a sample verse, with the names of the stars who will sing each line:

Make toast, not war, let the children know (Avril Lavigne)
Spread peace like butter, watch it start to grow (Jay Z)
Add the marmalade, that your karma made (Madonna)
Crust is justice, just trust this toasted flow (50 Cent)

Thursday, April 3, 2008 - Dr. Toast mixes it up with Mimosa, Epcot, Kitty D, and Neptune. New tracks from Mimosa and Kitty D, and freestyling from Epcot throughout the night! $5, 10pm-2am, Shine (1337 Mission between 9th & 10th, San Francisco). More info at Tribe.net

Dr. Toast - "The Wave Function" (2008)

posted March 27, 2008 | music, releases



Radiant textures and melodies over deep, head-nodding beats and dirty analog basslines - the perfect soundtrack for a midnight drive through the desert. Over three years in the making, "The Wave Function" is the result of my continuing immersion in San Francisco music and art communities. My eyes and ears are always being turned on to something new and strange and beautiful, and I hope you'll be able to hear some of that in these songs. I am eternally thankful for all of the support and encouragement that has made this music possible, and I hope you'll enjoy listening as much as I've enjoyed making it. You can grab it now from your choice of:

Bandcamp.com - high-quality MP3, AAC, or lossless FLAC formats
cdbaby.com - limited-edition CD featuring original artwork by Dr. Toast
Addictech.com - high-quality MP3 or lossless FLAC/WAV formats
iTunes - high-quality m4a format ("iTunes Plus")
Amazon.com - high-quality MP3 format

"I can't stop listening to your tunes. It never leaves my player. It's hit me harder than anything has in a long time." - Brando

False Profit Records FPR-101 - 11 tracks - 67min 13sec



Dr. Toast - "The Entanglement EP" (2008)

posted March 25, 2008 | music, releases

Released simultaneously with "The Wave Function", these are four tracks of evolving textures with skronked-up basslines and slow, funky breakbeats - harder-edged than what's on the album, but still with the right amount of bliss factor dialed in. You can download it now at the new False Profit Records minisite at Addictech in high-quality MP3 or lossless FLAC/WAV formats - falseprofit.addictech.com, or you can download MP3s at CD Baby, or download from iTunes in m4a format ("iTunes Plus").

"SKRONKED!!! Can't get over it. Makes my synaesthesia so happy, don't even know where to begin... :)" - Galit Sorokin


01. Logico 7:04 listen/buy
02. Skronked 4:40 listen/buy
03. Tvashtar 5:17 listen/buy
04. Grounded 6:04 listen/buy

4 tracks - 23min 01sec - buy from addictech.com, buy from cdbaby.com

Inflatable Toast!

posted March 18, 2008 | toast-links

Wow. From Archie McPhee: "Toast is great, but it’s hard to keep in your pocket. So what do you do when you crave the warm comfort of toast but don’t want to deal with the crumbs? You pull out your Inflatable Toast, blow it up and admire its realistic toasty goodness! Each soft vinyl slice of toast is 6" tall and has a standard inflation valve." Get yours today!



Dr. Toast Live at NASA (Yuri's Night 2008)

posted March 13, 2008 | shows

Saturday, April 12, 2008 - For the second year in a row, Dr. Toast has been invited to perform his music in a big ol' aircraft hangar at NASA! Yuri's Night is a celebration of the anniversary of the first human spaceflight with a fusion of art, science, music, and dance. The lineup also includes Amon Tobin, John Tejada, Lusine, Scuba, Digitonal vs Posthuman, Deru, Tycho, Random Rab, Mr. Projectile, Ganucheau, and more! More info, Tickets


The Wave Function - CD Release Party

posted March 7, 2008 | shows

My new album "The Wave Function" is coming out on a brand new label, False Profit Records! You can hear a few of the new tracks on my MySpace page. The record release party is happening on Thursday, March 27, at Poleng Lounge (1751 Fulton St. in San Francisco), from 10pm to 2am. Also featuring performances by Welder, Mr. Projectile, and F'kir. The party is only $5, or for $10 you get to take home a copy of the CD! Food, drinks, music, and a free toast bar! If you can't make it, be sure to get on my mailing list so I can let you know when the album is for sale online.


Dr. Toast Live @ Toast & Tea

posted February 25, 2008 | shows

My thanks to Melvin Priester for hosting this listening party for my new music! Melvin says:

"A good number of my favorite Burning Man stories now start like this, 'I was hanging out in our dome and then Dr. Toast started playing...' Simply put, lying on fuzzy gymmats, listening to Dr. Toast play live, watching cool visuals on a tricked out system is one of my favorite things in the world. So, in celebration of Dr. Toast's forthcoming new CD, The Wave Function, and also my impending departure for Europe and South America (leaving SF for A WHILE March 12), we will be recreating that set-up, sans dust, on March 6 from 8:30 to 11 p.m. @ the amazing loft of the man who has provided both the cush and the sound behind so many of my favorite burning man experiences."

WHAT: Dr. Toast Listening Party. WHEN: Thursday, March 6, 2008, 8:30 - 11:00 p.m. (Toast starts playing a little after 9). WHERE: 865 Florida St., Space 2. VISUALS: MC Um Amel (UCSC Digital Arts/New Media). SOUND: Periphony Systems. DAMAGE: $10, in advance, via paypal to mpriester@gmail.com



Image of Big Bang Seen in Piece of Toast

posted February 20, 2008 | toast-news

Miracle toast? From the article: "Excitement is growing in the Northern England town of Huddlesfield following the news that a local man saw an image of the big-bang in a piece of toast. Atheist Donald Chapman, 36, told local newspaper The Huddlesfield Express that he was sitting down to eat breakfast when an unusual toast pattern caught his eye..."
